newsitem.title: USA: U.S. EXPORTERS CAN NOT CONFIRM EGYPT WHEAT TENDER.
newsitem.headline: U.S. EXPORTERS CAN NOT CONFIRM EGYPT WHEAT TENDER.

text.p: Several U.S. exporters said they could not confirm market talk that Egypt would be seeking 200,000 to 300,000 tonnes U.S. soft red winter wheat late this week or this weekend.
But exporters did not rule out the possibility since Egypt has been recently absent from the market.
"Everybody also expects that (tender) at the end of the week but we have nothing firm," one wheat exporter said.
Chicago Board of Trade soft red winter wheat futures closed higher on prospects for increased exports of U.S. wheat, traders said.
CBOT September wheat gained 8-3/4 cents at $3.62 a bushel.
Since they were absent last weekend it would make sense for Egypt to get the balance of their requirements, another wheat exporter said. "But I can not confirm that," he said.
On July 27, Egypt's official commodities buyer said he purchased between 200,000 to 215,000 tonnes of U.S. SRW wheat for September delivery.
A third exporter said he did not know for sure but said there were indications Egypt may be in soon for wheat.
